verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329><s%> Musician <S%H5329><s%> upon Gittith, <S%H1665><s%> A Psalm of Asaph. <S%H623><s%> Sing <S%H7442><s%> aloud <S%H7442><s%> to God <S%H430><s%> our strength: <S%H5797><s%> make a joyful noise to the God <S%H430><s%> of Jacob. <S%H3290><s%>
Take <S%H5375><s%> a psalm, <S%H2172><s%> and bring <S%H5414><s%> here the tambourine, <S%H8596><s%> the pleasant <S%H5273><s%> harp <S%H3658><s%> with the psaltery. <S%H5035><s%>
Blow <S%H8628><s%> up the trumpet <S%H7782><s%> in the new <S%H2320><s%> moon, <S%H2320><s%> in the time appointed, <S%H3677><s%> on our solemn <S%H2282><s%> feast <S%H2282><s%> day. <S%H3117><s%>
For this <S%H1931><s%> was a statute <S%H2706><s%> for Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and a law <S%H4941><s%> of the God <S%H430><s%> of Jacob. <S%H3290><s%>

This he ordained <S%H7760><s%> in Joseph <S%H3084><s%> for a testimony, <S%H5715><s%> when he went <S%H3318><s%> out through <S%H5921><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt: <S%H4714><s%> where I heard <S%H8085><s%> a language <S%H8193><s%> that I understood <S%H3045><s%> not.
I removed <S%H5493><s%> his shoulder <S%H7926><s%> from the burden: <S%H5449><s%> his hands <S%H3709><s%> were delivered <S%H5674><s%> from the pots. <S%H1731><s%>

You called <S%H7121><s%> in trouble, <S%H6869><s%> and I delivered <S%H2502><s%> you; I answered <S%H6030><s%> you in the secret <S%H5643><s%> place of thunder: <S%H7482><s%> I proved <S%H974><s%> you at <S%H5291><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> of Meribah. <S%H4809><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
Hear, <S%H8085><s%> O my people, <S%H5971><s%> and I will testify <S%H5749><s%> to you: O Israel, <S%H3478><s%> if <S%H518><s%> you will listen <S%H8085><s%> to me;
There shall no <S%H3808><s%> strange <S%H2114><s%> god <S%H410><s%> be in you; neither <S%H3808><s%> shall you worship <S%H7812><s%> any strange <S%H5236><s%> god. <S%H410><s%>

I am the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God, <S%H430><s%> which brought <S%H5927><s%> you out of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt: <S%H4714><s%> open your mouth <S%H6310><s%> wide, <S%H7337><s%> and I will fill <S%H4390><s%> it.
But my people <S%H5971><s%> would not listen <S%H8085><s%> to my voice; <S%H6963><s%> and Israel <S%H3478><s%> would <S%H14><s%> none <S%H3808><s%> of me.
So I gave <S%H7971><s%> them up to their own hearts' <S%H3820><s%> lust: <S%H8307><s%> and they walked <S%H3212><s%> in their own counsels. <S%H4156><s%>
Oh <S%H3863><s%> that my people <S%H5971><s%> had listened <S%H8085><s%> to me, and Israel <S%H3478><s%> had walked <S%H1980><s%> in my ways! <S%H1870><s%>
I should soon <S%H4592><s%> have subdued <S%H3665><s%> their enemies, <S%H341><s%> and turned <S%H7725><s%> my hand <S%H3027><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> their adversaries. <S%H6862><s%>
The haters <S%H8130><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> should have submitted <S%H3584><s%> themselves to him: but their time <S%H6256><s%> should have endured <S%H1961><s%> for ever. <S%H5769><s%>

He should have fed <S%H398><s%> them also with the finest <S%H2459><s%> of the wheat: <S%H2406><s%> and with honey <S%H1706><s%> out of the rock <S%H6697><s%> should I have satisfied <S%H7649><s%> you.
